Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing experience at room 911”
Reviews.Author: mbkhan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Al Sondos Suites last year. This is an amazing hotel. Its located right opposite Deira city Centre opposite the Splash store enterance. It was an amazing experience SPG standard was up to mark. the room was BIG, our room was on 9th floor with amazing view and amazing room number was 911. the room included a sofa set and also a sofa bed which was used by my child. The hotel is connected to the Dubai metro directly as the metro station entry is next to the hotel restaurant. the exit of the station connects City Centre! If u love Dubai metro and wana explore the city by metro this is a great place to stay. The in room dining was great. the room facilities included : full serviced italian style kitchen and bar counter Tea coffee making facility dedicated iron and board LCD 42" screen Washing machine Refrigerator Microwave Oven Electric Stoves Large wash room with shower cubical free use of GYM & pool. The pool is quite small but great to beat the heat on a warm day. its more of a business hotel and u wont find any guests in gym or pool during the week day.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: archenemy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at right beside the entrance of Deira City Metro station. Though it is convenient, it is at the same time pretty quiet, away from the hustle & bustle of Dubai. Opposite the road is Deira City Mall, so its convenient for you to get food or get some shopping done. Rooms are pretty decent,clean and comfortable. staff are helpful. wireless Internet connection is a bit costly at 77AED per device per day. I think it will be fair if they charged a flat rate of 77AED for 24 hours regardless of the number of devices connected. I travelled with a colleague and we had a laptop & a smart phone each. imagine us connecting all 4 devices. the breakfast was a bit short of le meridian standards too. not much variety to choose from, though we had our fill every morning. room service was surprisingly quick, though again, the menu was limited. it will be very good if they could expand the menu for us travellers to have more to choose from. nevertheless i had a very good stay, save for the food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the FX tricks!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalExplorator
Reviews.Content: Good stay overall, but the hotel ruined it by getting greedy and charging my credit card in US dollars - and at an extortionate rate (DHS 3.55 / USD 1 vs. the DHS 3.67 market rate) - without me requesting them to do so (as an aside, I notice that the NBD ATMs are now doing the same thing, although they have at least the courtesy to warn you that you are able to be screwed on the FX rate). As a result, they made a few extra bucks and left me with a very sour taste in my mouth. This is not the first time I've had a hotel do this (one 5* outfit in Delhi pulled the same ruse), but that does not make it right. Hotel rates in Dubai are ridiculous enough without establishments having to resort to such trickery.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dieguidson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 5 or 6 times, one per year, it is a good hotel, with a good location with the metro station right in the entrance of the hotel. The hotel is very clean, organize and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments”
Reviews.Author: dariotime
Reviews.Content: This in an hotel with HUGE rooms. It's has good location for who comes to Dubai for business instead then holidays. The apartments have everything you need inside with kitchen, living room, two bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. The hotel is located close to the creek and right in front there is a nice mall. Unfortunately it's very far from the beach and the historical town. However, taxis are quite cheap and it's easy to move around.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay but Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Choukie2007
Reviews.Content: Nice stay but really short, one night. There was a Washington machine in the suite. We were Emirates guest at this hotel. I enjoyed m'y stay hère. It was not far from the airport. There was a warm welcome for us and we had breakfast included in the suit and a complimentary drink for us during our stay. There was an early Check out which were express. The car was waiting for us outside. The réception took care of the confirmation of our car. The wake up call was on Time. Our stay was perfect in Dubai. I would advise you this hotel for short stay and may be longer stay?! I haven t been to the swimming so i won t. Be able to talk about it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naveed20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice,clean and quiet. Good location next to a Mall and Metro station. Only draw back are the bathrooms which are a bit jaded compared to all the new hotels springing up in Dubai. Staff is courteous and very helpful.Another negative point were the pillows are very hard tried to obtain a soft one which was a bit better but I'm used to a very soft down pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trix59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights and loved it, the rooms were clean, beds comfortable and staff were polite and friendly.The only downside was if you wanted free Internet you had to go downstairs for it which is a little inconvenient, and the cost for room Internet was overpriced. Other than that it's close to international airport,shops,and transport.it also has a washer dryer in kitchenette which was great after our travels. Will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, I was surprised”
Reviews.Author: AXH
Reviews.Content: This hotel/apartment/suites building is very limited in services as it is not your conventional hotel in Dubai. It doesn't have an alcohol license so there are no extended facilities that usually come with that. Which means, no pub and no extended service hours for the restaurants. For example, if it is past 9PM forget about soup, room service will bring you spaghetti. That is all that I can say about negatives. The service in the hotel is excellent, from the reception to the cleaning crew. They are helpful and natural, you cannot feel any sort of forced politeness in them. The room is fine, it is actually a one bed room apartment, separate bedroom. Full kitchen and large living room. The furniture of the hotel is old but well maintained and it is not falling apart. I will return there if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to Deira City Ctr shops”
Reviews.Author: cakeface
Reviews.Content: If it's a stopover in Dubai and you want to be walking distance from a good sized shopping mall with cinemas/food/clothes outlets etc. then this will fit the bill. Receiption and restaurant had very friendly staff and all well presented. The room was fairly large, air con a little noisy and the grouting in the bathroom needed updating. If the kitchen is important to you then you will be dissappointed. Hardly any utensils to speak of. No glasses for wine, no cutlery, only 2 small plates in the cupboard, tiny electric jug and limited coffee supply. Certainly no milk but you could buy it at the supermarket across at the shopping centre. wifi is free in the restaurant so we checked our emails at breakfast.To reach to mall, go right outside the hotel. You will see a glass enclosure inside which you can descend the stairs and cross underneath the very busy roadway. You come up at the other side right at the entrance to the shopping mall where you will find everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good place with very good staff”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to not spend a ton but want to stay at a nice place LITERALLY off the train, this is a good spot. The staff is fantastic, I have to say. They were very helpful in finding an adapter to work with my plug. It took some time, and some help from the engineer for it to get in working order, however, this did not change their upbeat and helpful moods! Rooms are pretty nice and spacious. The bedding is oh kay, the mattress is not so great. Bathroom is relatively fine, although the bathtub could have been reglazed or updated. It was a bit yucky. It's nice that the hotel is right next to Deira City Centre Mall, which provides you access to walk around somewhere. Also, having the Metro right there was superb. It is so cheap to get to the airport from there and takes no time at all. I would say the best use of staying here is if you have a layover of a nite, or if you are in town just for a quick jaunt and are not too concerned about seeing the fancier, new part of Dubai. If you are here for a week, you might as well stay in one of the more upscale hotels because the fun stuff to do is about a 25 minute metro ride away. This is a good one or two night place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms, and great staff”
Reviews.Author: trainaholic
Reviews.Content: This the second time we stay at this hotel. Many people confuse this place with much cheaper Sondos Apts by le meridian, this one is much better. The suites are big. You have a mini kitchen in the room with a small washer which my wife loved since we have a messy little 2 year old that keeps getting her cloth dirty. A couple things the we didn't like was the windows from the outside really need a cleaning, not that big of deal. My main concern was the shower water, it kept on getting cold and hot by it self, they didn't know why it was doing so, really annoying but we manged to stay in the room because all our stuff was out already. Wifi in the room is charged but you can get free internet in the restaurant, just as a waiter for the password. I would come back here again, we stayed at three other Dubai hotels, this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: EuroTrav2011
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Al Sondos Suites, the room was perfectly furnished, very clean, and comfortable. The rate was very good too. Location wise, this facility is perfect for short stopover in Dubai since it is close to the airport and very near to the big mall (Deira City Center), if the weather is good then you can easily walk Don’t expect a fancy lobby or big restaurant but for sure you can get a great value

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarago
Reviews.Content: it was nice for a one day stopover. its near the Dubai City Center Mall which is great. Staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: violet19
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. I made a mistake with our booking, indicating that we'd like king singles (when we actually wanted a king bed). To 'make up' for the 'inconvenience' (as I said - totally my mistake when booking) they upgraded us to a beautiful suite. The only reason we probably won't stay here again is that next time we'll be in Dubai, our son will be old enough for some of the 'adventure' facilities (eg, waterslides) that this one doesn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Several stays now........location is brilliant for everything!”
Reviews.Author: Leannamarie63
Reviews.Content: Last stay was May 2011 being my second stay, my travel companion has stayed several times over the last six years. He, having stayed at other hotels near the ocean said they don't match this one to location and easy access to everything, I agree! Every suite that we have stayed in has been immaculate, queen bed, full size fridge/freezer, clothes washer/dryer, basic cooking facilities, flat screen TV etc. Free internet use in ground floor lobby off to the right and tour booking facilities available at reception. Breakfast choices are great, with wonderful service. Only a few minutes from the airport by taxi, very easy access. Walk across the road and you are at the metro train station and Deira City shopping arcade. Everything you need is in the arcade, restaurants, clothes, movies...the works! Can book the double decker hop on hop off bus from here, there were two lines when we did this in January 2010 and they are well worth it. Included in the ticket is the boat ride on Dubai Creek. Train stations are easy to buy tickets at, regular and fast service which gives you easy access to all the great malls. Can give advice on jewellery shops, malls and sites if interested.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: muhanadm
Reviews.Content: I loved it, nice place, clean, And very close to Dubai metro. Try it and you will see :)

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched Location”
Reviews.Author: reli01
Reviews.Content: I along with my family spent two days over a weekend at this perfectly located hotel in the heart of Dubai. The best and most convenient aspect of the location is Dubai Metro station which is just next door. Secondly Deira City Centre was across the road. We did not have to even walk a minute in the heat to take the trains or go across to the shopping mall. The service was also fairly efficient. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very clean and surprisingly quiet. The breakfast buffet was elaborate. What else one can expect when one is out shopping most of the time! Three cheers to Al Sondos Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suite & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Musqat
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to try this hotel because of its proximity to the Metro and City Centre. The rates now are very competitive (Dh 350/$95). As an SPG Platinum member I was given a spacious 1-bedroom suite, which had a well-equipped kitchen, 1.5 baths and a separate bedroom with ample closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great suite, best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: imissneworleans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and thought the suite was nice, with all the amenities you would expect from a quality hotel. The breakfast was the best I've had in a hotel. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In This Hotel - Very Very Dirty”
Reviews.Author: HMakled
Reviews.Content: As SPG member since long and stayed in several hotels around the world, I had never seen a dirty hotel like this one (Carpet, Lenin, Curtains & what makes it worst the bed). Arrived very late night after booking on SPG.COM and confirmed over the phone and had my reservation with a very lazy person behind the desk not welling to help at all. I had requested for my reservation and he found it after that I had told him that I called and need to room ASAP as my kids are sleeping and I need to take them to bed. He mentioned that the room is not a studio type and I have to pay more for that. I confirmed that as SPG member he could deduct from my points and give me the room immediately as my kids were sleeping. He insisted on arguing with me and told me that this is not possible as you need to do the booking over the internet, when he felt that I am getting upset and my voice was start to raise up he checked and found that this is possible on the instant redemption form. Got the room and went up, unfortunately non-smoking room, he did not even take the time to check my preferences which is recorded on his computer through SPG and my previous stays in this hotel. Changed the room and asked for the baby coat and the sofa to be opened for my kids to sleep, housekeeping arrived and try to open the sofa (It was broken). Finally got an extra bed and put my kids to sleep. while checking out I had informed the reception person about what happen last night but the only thing that she could say, ahhhhh ahhhhh no sorry or apology. Bad hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some strange aspects”
Reviews.Author: amirali10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice, big spacious rooms with kitchenette and very comfortable location opposite City Center and 20 m from the Metro. Free Internet in business center was also a big plus. It does offer good value for money - for sure. Just a couple of aspects which I found strange and annoying - they did not let me check early (I arrived at around 8:45 am) even though the room was available. They asked me for 50% room charge for early check in which I declined. This gave me a feeling like they did not care about their guests. Also there was a strange music in the elevators - I guess the intention was to have a feel of the 'amazon jungle', but it was too loud for comfort. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring the city on public transport”
Reviews.Author: brainzone
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent for public transport option - it's right on top of the Deira City Centre Metro Station (a word of warning: Check the operating times yourself – hotel staff was not knowledgeable on this subject). Deira City Center shopping mall is right across the street, and includes a reasonable food court, coffee shop options and a very large Carrefour store if you prefer to dine in your hotel room. Got upgraded to a very spacious 1 bedroom suite as a Starwood Platinum member. Comfortable bed, full kitchen – and despite the rather central location no complaints about traffic noise at all. Only negative to report would be the lack of towels: 1 ½ baths, and only 1 large and 1 small towel? Was OK for a single person, 1 night stay – however I feel more should be the standard for such a property. I arrived in the morning hours, and the hotel was fully booked so no early check-in. Would have been nice from the hotel staff to offer me to get changed in the health club or wait at the pool deck – but not being aware that there was either I spend a good four hours in nearby Deira historic district.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and convinient.”
Reviews.Author: funkyhi
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel . we checked in around 12 in the night after a late fligt and checkin was a breeze. It is very convinient located next to the new metro station and mall. Plenty od taxis are available in the mall. It is only 2 metro stations away from the airport which made it more convinient. We ordered room service late in the night at 2 and the food was really good. My kids also liked the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Muneera
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a great location, the metro station is right at the door step, Deira City center is just across the road. Free parking onsite, excellent staff. I stayed there 2 times, my birthday happened during my stay there and the hotel surprised me with a delicious black forest birthday cake in my room. I stayed in the studio room which was wonderful and spacious with full kitchenette along with a washer. And I also stayed in a one bedroom apartment at a previous stay. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Small but spacious, and ritzy!”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: I have been bookied in this hotel by Emirates during a stopover in Dubai (travelling in First Class). The check-in/check-out timings were flexible as I checked in at 04:00 and checked out at 23:00. The rooms, or should I say suites, were very spacious and decorated in good taste, so was there cosy brasserie-style restaurant serving open buffet. Opposite the hotel is a large shopping mall. I would say the only drawback was the non availability of taxis, which has to be substituted by a limo from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrigitteLucretia
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful staff. Walking distance to Diera Centre Shopping Mall where you can get a Night Bus Tour of the city also walk 1 minute to the Metro Station which has 26 stops where you can get off to do Emirates and Dubai Malls. Room had a kitchenette which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Neat clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: samba4
Reviews.Content: Very neat & clean rooms with excellent service - in particular Yaseen at check in and Gabriel were both amazing. Loaction is right next to the Metro giving easy access to all tourist & shopping attractions. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Life Saver”
Reviews.Author: ChipLondon
Reviews.Content: We were forced to find accomodation at the last minute, when stranded in Dubai by the Volcanic ash issues. By chance I found the Al Sondas Suite on the internet, it offered accomodation at a reasonable rate at a time when we were not expecting to have our budget tested. However we were really lucky Al Sondas Suites are in a great location right next door to the City Centre Mall. Dubai is a strange place that is really spread out, so wherever you stay will always be the wrong side of town, if going somewhere else, Therefore The Al Sondas are as well located as any other hotel or appartments., and taxis are really cheap in Dubai. Al Sondas offers nice studio or one bedroom appartments that are clean, well equiped and comfortable, it really feels like a hotel but with the advantage of having a kitchenette available. The only draw back is the pool deck is small, and often in the shade. The staff are really helpful and I recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: ...but it won't knock your socks off either. I stayed here a couple extra nights after a business trip. I was able to use my SPG points last minute. I liked being next to the mall and the train. It simply "met" expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Fab221
Reviews.Content: Great apartment suites, nice location just across the street from City Centre. Service truly awful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay, with superficial Quirks”
Reviews.Author: ranjah007
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel room for a King Studio on a lay over in Dubai. Check in was quick and pleasant. Once I got to the room, it was a Twin Room, not the King I had booked. I went down and the front desk immediately upgraded me to an Executive Studio with a King bed. The room was clean and in very good upkeep. Service in the hotel was also excellent and plenty of shops in the area. I really can't find any real faults. The only thing I would knock is the quality of the mattress. It is extremely thin and a very hard bed to sleep on. Also, the location in Bur Dubai made it a long drive into the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service in otherwise ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petteri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good location as described in several other reviews: right next to metro stop and Deira City Centre shopping mall. Rooms are ok, size is excellent but other than that nothing spectacular. "City view" that was advertised in room description meant that we can see the wall of the opposite building in an alley... Overall the hotel itself is ok. I feel calling this hotel "top-value" is over-rating... but most importantly, they do have serious problems in their service attitude: I'll try to keep the story not too long. We were first in the morning promised to have early check-in at 11:30 am., but when we came back at 1:00 pm. ready to check-in, they said "room is not available, should be soon". This "soon" eventually took 1,5 hours before I asked for the manager-on-duty. He was arrogant and didn't seem to take the issue too seriously. We finally got the room at 2:55 pm - 3,5 hours later than promised and the official check-in time was anyway at 3:00 pm... I was especially disappointed with the front desk staff and manager-on-duty attitude. Due to their lack of service attitude, I can't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for DXB.”
Reviews.Author: jg1way
Reviews.Content: My stay at Le Meridien was great. It is located next to the new metro system and the City Centre shopping mall. I enjoyed my room very much for its spaciousness. I had a one bedroom suite which was perfect. A full service kitchen with washing machine. One issue however was trying to obtain a kitchen knife, when I was treated like a five year old by housekeeping, warning me to me very very careful and not cut to myself because the knife is very very sharp. I had to laugh at this event though, very funny if you think about it. Another point, and I find this a common issue at many hotels in Asia and the Middle East, is the 'hotel taxi'. Prices for these are often double or more and the concierge or front desk are under strict orders to steer guests towards this "icing on the cake" enterprise for hotel owners. Be warned. Overall I had a great stay and rest.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Stammerman
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a very good location for a great price. Despite arriving a few hours early, our check-in was handled by a young lady who was friendly and efficient. The rooms are furnished at an above average standard and are very comfortable. But also note the location - The hotel is located less than 100 metres away from Diera City Metro station giving you good and cheap access to most of the main tourist attractions in Dubai and the Dubai Mall which is one of the World's largest malls. By the way, the Dubai Metro is spotless and a lot of the journey is above ground so you se some great views. In addition just another 100 metres or so and you have access to another very large mall - Deira City Mall where my wife was able to do some serious damage to my credit card!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FMoha
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a really enjoyable stay at Al Sondos. The check in process was speedy and bonus points to the hotel for scanning the passports rather than as is traditional in Dubai to keep your passport for the duration of the stay. My family and I had booked two adjoining rooms, one deluxe and the other executive, each were tastefully decorated, spacious, and had modern amenities. The kitchenette facility in each room was well eqquipped and was really helpful to us as we were also travelling with a young child. We ordered room service the first evening we checked in after a very long flight and it was reasonably priced. The hotel was literally on the door step of Deira Metro Station which we utilised to go Jumierah beach, the Burj and the Mall of the Emirates - the train system was reliable and way cheaper (and faster) as Dubai traffic is a nigthmare. Deira City Centre is also a hop, skip and jump from the hotel, a good place for shopping and it also has a supermarket - I suggest going through the Deira Metro Station to reach the Centre as J-Walking is not for the faint hearted. While we were there, we also made use of the business centre (free PC, internet and printing). We were not impressed with the pool as it was quite small and in a very shady position. Overall, our stay was very enjoyable, and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value - great location”
Reviews.Author: Fosseboy
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Dubai. We spent hours researching locations, hotels and apartments and read some very detailed reviews on this apartment. We stayed 3 nights. It is close to the airport, next to the new metro, with a big shopping centre and Carrefour opposite. So it was easy to buy good value food and drink. The Big Bus tour departs from near Carrefour which was also handy. We were able to print off flight boarding cards easily in the business centre and there was free wifi in the lounge. The apartment was smart, clean and comfortable but some utensils were missing or tired. Staff very helpful - concierges in particular- except reception which was frosty every time we approached them. Starwood membership was recognised at this Le Meridien but there was no special welcome from the reception! It was too hot to venture out far anyway so we did not miss a creek or beach location. We went on the tour bus with a 2 day ticket, used the metro and went in 2 shopping malls. We saw other great hotels but at an enormous room rate. Breakfast was incuded but after check-in, a pre printed letter was put through the door saying we had only paid for 1 breakfast in our rate. I think this is easy to get wrong on the website. But it was then cheaper to pay for the breakfast in the dining room than add the extra person to the room rate. We would use this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Sizzling Hot !”
Reviews.Author: galoria
Reviews.Content: Located just 5-6min from the airport,The Alsondos Suites has all the benefits of a self contained apartment and a 4 star hotel combined with Large rooms with kitchenettes. Great bathrooms,Lifes Real Good here,we were also greeted with fruit juice and refreshing towel which was a nice touch,also great attention for kids with all the special treatments,we also had a visit to its heart i.e the kitchen,Lovely Cooks Delicious Food,Great Servings And Exciting gifts for Kids,More Tnah our Kids enjoyed Staying in the Pool,Ha! Ha!,Would Recommend Plz visit the Sr.Chef to have his own recipie in the evening with Dine n Wine..!For Any Quiries Contact me 9922863486

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: wileyc0y0te
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay, though the beds leave a bit to be desired as they aren't too comfortable. Very centrally located and there is free wifi in the cafe on the first floor, though they charge you a fortune for internet in the room. The staff was absurdly friendly and my favorite part of the stay; as they are helpful in every way, including the free ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sussexali
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week at the Al Sondos by Le Meridien travelling with my 17 year old daughter. We were looking for a convenient location for a mix of beach, relaxation, shopping and sight seeing. Were upgraded to a one bedroom apartment at no extra cost which was beautifully appointed and very comfortable. The recently opened City Centre metro stop is literally 1 minute walk from the hotel and there is a direct train to Terminal 3 at the airport, also used the metro to get to the Emirates Mall. It costs 5 dirham per trip per person (around 80 pence) and is much cheaper and faster than taxis. The metro station also serves as a subway across to the Mall and is a safeter way to cross the busy street. The hotel reception staff were friendly and tried to be helpful but are unknowlegable about the area. They assured us that the Gold Souk was easily walkable from the hotel but it took over 20 minutes by taxi. There is a leisure desk which was never manned and only were interested in selling tours from a brochure which were at hugely inflated prices. The pool is TINY (the photographer must have used a very wide angled lens on their website) and largely in the shade so not a place to catch some sun. Had some great days out which were all easily reachable from the hotel. The desert safari (booked from a tourist brochure picked up at the airport) is a must - paid 150 dirhams per person - the hotel wanted 220. Al Mamza Park is about 10 minutes by taxi in the opposite direction to Jumeirah Beach. 5 dirhams per person entry to a beautiful park and 3 beaches which were virtually empty, cafes, showers and taxis readily accessible. Spent a day at Wild Wadi water park, was given a 2 for 1 entry by a stranger in the queue (thank you!) which was fun but the new water park at Atlantis is supposed to be much bigger and better although did not go there. Ate at Al Bustan Hotel and had some of the best Lebansese food ever tasted and not at all expensive. The Al Sondos is a dry hotel as is the mall opposite so make sure you bring / buy all you need on your way into Dubai unless you want to spend ages searching for a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: LittleLeah
Reviews.Content: HOTEL AND ROOMS: Because there was 4 of us, we had a 2 bedroom, 3 bathroom suite with an entry hallway, full kitchen, full dining table, living room with pull out couch and a washer and dryer. There was a fruit basket on the first day and the newspaper was delivered every morning. The staff was very nice, the hotel was beautiful, and free internet. There was a small pool, and the gym was always empty. Parking was always available underground, and a friend that lives in Dubai was able to drive in and park with no problems. LOCATION: The hotel was located in Deira, across the street from City Centre mall, which is a huge mall. Also close to the Gold Souk and the dinner boat cruises on the river. We were able to walk over to the mall and hop onto the Big Bus tour, also able to walk along the river. The hotel was a good location for us, but still quite far from the Jumeira Beach area. The Big Bus tour was awesome because we were able to make it around Dubai and get off and on the bus no problem. Make sure you start first thing in the morning because there is a lot to see. TRANSPORTATION: Dubais public transportation system is really bad, most tourists do not take the bus, but take cabs instead. Cabs are quite cheap, but traffic can be very bad and because of the layout of the city, it can become quite expensive to drive from point A to point B so make sure to plan out your trips. When we were visiting, they were in the process of building a sky train. SIGHTS: Desert Safari - awesome Big Bus tour - awesome Global Village - horrible, total culture shock, full of crap Mall of the Emirates - awesome Burj Al Arab - amazing Jumeria Beach - beautiful, but not much to it Palm Island, Atlantis Hotel - Awesome Dinner Boat cruise - really nice We went during the shopping festival, and it was great because all the stores have something on sale - better sales then i get at home. The dates for the shopping festival change every year so check online but its ususally mid January to mid February. Dubai was amazing to see, but it is a very expensive city and the sites are very spread out. It was very helpful to have a friend that lived there to be our private tour guide!

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: DemiAtl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Al Sondos in Oct for 5days and l was quite impressed. The service was good, the location is excellent, opposite the mall and even with the construction going on, it was a very short walk to the mall. The staff were courteous and will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “still a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lylacwings
Reviews.Content: Last month, we went for Dubai for a business. my friend is working at Westin so can get a 'Special rate'. When I arrived the hotel on the first day 7 am, the staff told me that the room is not ready until 9 am, so we said we will wait until 9 am (otherwise charge 50% of room rate if check in early). The staff led us to a sofa to rest and gave us 2 bottle mineral water. When we starting to open the cover, the receptionist told us that the room is ready, I quite wonder their responsiveness!!! When I go inside the room, it quite impresses. The room is a 'Studio' type, (bed room, kitchen and bath room). The room is clean, tiny, and the facility is quite complete. The bed is twin bed, it’s tiny and clean. However, the bed is quite old, because when you lie down and get out on the bed, there was a concave on the bed. Beside, I think the size of bed is quite small for Asia People nor western, as you make a turn u might on the floor. For the kitchen, I think is can be consider full equipment, it include 2 hot stove, pans, utensils for cooking & dinner, fridge, kitchen ventilator, toaster, kittle, washing machine, microwave. We make our breakfast everyday, it’s convenience and saving in term of time and money. The utensil includes fork, shovel, a Tefal Pan, and so on but except spoon for dining. The fridge temperature is normal, but the door could not close properly, you have to ‘kick’ it then only can be close ‘tightly. When you finish cooking, just leave the plate or utensil on the sink, the room services will be clean on you. The bath room is ok. The temperature of water is hot and strong enough. The room is complete with soup, shampoo, condition and body lotion However; their only prepare 1 bathrobe for 2 guests. The hotel is also not providing slipper, comb and shaver. The Air-con is central control type. I found it’s is a bit ‘dry’ in mid night. The room cleaning service is normal. Their just clean what ever they ‘see’ and neglect a very detail matter. Like we go for sand surfing at night, when we come back we wash in the bath room, so there are a plenty of sand on the bath room, at next day we went out and came back at night, we found the sand still there. The location of this hotel is strategy located opposite the Diera Mall. Unfortunate, there constructions between both building, so we have to take a long distance to reach the mall. If not, the location is convenience. Beside, if you have better budget, you should take hotel’s taxi rather then public one. The cost for hotel is 3 – 4 times higher then public taxi. The main point to choose the hotel taxi are there driving attitude is much better and will let you have dizzied. Overall, I satisfied with the hotel. I will come back to stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “mostly amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fercarmic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was great! They accomadated me when I checked in at 10am (6 hours early!) and were able to check my baggage. I was also greeted with fruit juice and refreshing towel which was a nice touch. They also upgraded me to a suite and it was lovely! I used the gym once, and it was ok. Never used the pool. Had breakfast in the News Cafe once, it was good but pricey. The kitchette features were very handy, although its tough to use the kettle (two prong appliance that you have to shove into a three prong outlet). The construction outside the hotel was a tad noisy but not too bad - and I was on the 2nd floor and it was right outside my window. What was noisy at times was the drainage system which ran water from other rooms right through the wall near my bed. But I only heard that in the mornings. The best thing about the hotel was the service! Absolutely great!

Reviews.Title: “Al Sondos Suites - Great location & Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: howzatperth
Reviews.Content: The Alsondos Suites has all the benefits of a self contained apartment and a 4 star hotel combined. Located 5 mins from the airport with Jumerah Beach only 15mins by taxi away and directly opposite a big shopping centre, we found this place to be a really nice place to stay. There is a pool, gym, restaurant, room service,satelite tv -infact everything you could wish for. The rooms are serviced everyday, the hotel is very clean and the staf fare friendly and effeceint. The bedroom, bathroom and loung/dinning area were huge. And the prices for staying here were cheap compared with hotels in Dubai.

HotelInfo.Name: Al Sondos Suites by Le Meridien
HotelInfo.Address: Opposite Deira City Centre | Deira, Dubai 113562, United Arab Emirates
